segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Process Termination, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when an attempt is made to end a process.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Process Termination, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when an attempt is made to end a process.

segment.source: Audit Process Termination determines whether the operating system generates audit events when process has exited.
segment.target: Audit Process Termination determines whether the operating system generates audit events when process has exited.

segment.source: Success audits record successful attempts and Failure audits record unsuccessful attempts.
segment.target: Success audits record successful attempts and Failure audits record unsuccessful attempts.

segment.source: This policy setting can help you track user activity and understand how the computer is used.
segment.target: This policy setting can help you track user activity and understand how the computer is used.

segment.source: Event volume: Low to Medium, depending on system usage.
segment.target: Event volume: Low to Medium, depending on system usage.

segment.source: IF - This subcategory typically is not as important as Audit Process Creation subcategory.
segment.target: IF - This subcategory typically is not as important as Audit Process Creation subcategory.

segment.source: Using this subcategory you can, for example get information about for how long process was run in correlation with 4688 event.
segment.target: Using this subcategory you can, for example get information about for how long process was run in correlation with 4688 event.

segment.source: If you have a list of critical processes that run on some computers, you can enable this subcategory to monitor for termination of these critical processes.
segment.target: If you have a list of critical processes that run on some computers, you can enable this subcategory to monitor for termination of these critical processes.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
